number of helpful: 2 of 20 people (10%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 20, 2016
												When I purchased Stronghold HD, Stronghold Crusader HD came bundled with it and since I loved the original (my review of Stronghold HD can be found here), I had high hopes of it. The original was a great and unique combination of a castle/city builder and siege-simulator and this game is no different, basically the same game all over again, except that it's not that great anymore. The game feels like an expansion to the original game and not a sequel, mostly because it uses shamelessly everything from Stronghold HD, which wouldn't necessarily be a problem, but it remains inferior to the original in almost every aspect. The milieu is the (not so) vast deserts of the Middle East in the Holy Land mostly during the Third Crusade. The so called historical campaigns are separated from each other and seem rather inconsistent, so there's hardly a plot which makes the single player game unsatisfying. The skirmish missions are even less entertaining, so those don't help the game either. There's also an expansion called Stronghold Crusader Extreme HD, which is super disappointing and all it does that it allows the player to set custom games (which we can do in the main game as well) under extreme conditions and fight multiple opponents at the same time who tend to start with more resources than us... I managed to beat 2 at the same time, but it was a very poor experience, reminding me of old-school 'real-time strategy' games that functioned like meat grinders, where you train more and more troops and just unleash them on your enemies. Some 'strategy'...The main difference between the original game and this one is mainly the environment: instead of the beautiful English forestry, we get to play in deserts. It makes the game harder because now anything can catch fire and that introduces the only (!) new building (the other new one is basically a tent): the well. Yes, we can only put out the randomly appearing fires using wells (or instead of several small ones just one big well). Of course the wells also require workforce, so it is vital to have a few extra peasants. Naturally wells can't prevent the occurrence of fires, so the building on fire is going to take damage and if it's the armoury full of weapons... well, we're in trouble. The other factor is the oasis, which is the only suitable area we can build food production buildings on and needless to say, their size is quite limited. At least the oasis makes the game harder in a good way (requiring careful planning), as opposed to the random fire occurrences.In a few missions we can play the Muslim side, but these are commando missions (can't train units, have to make do with the given ones) only, so we can forget about larger sieges, the main strength of Stronghold. Of course there is sense in the Muslims having no buildings: they should look different than the ones the crusaders have... By the way the crusaders do have Middle-Eastern looking buildings which is a bit strange, but at this point it's really just one of the smaller problems.There are Arabian soldiers, mercenaries we can hire from the previously mentioned tents, for gold (instead of resources). This is an interesting formula as it can speed up the process of training quite a bit, but again, it can turn the game into grindfests at the expense of sieges. The new soldiers are fun (the slingers are fast and cheap but are weak and can attack at short range, the horse archers have great range and are very fast, but expensive and not as accurate as the normal archers), but they are mostly reused versions of the already existing units with readjusted strengths, except slaves (super cheap and weak units who can set buildings on fire) and the assassins (can climb walls and open castle gates). The assassin does have potential and can make a siege more interesting and a bit easier for the attacker. There's also a new fire ballista, a perfect tool for decimating defending archers on towers and it's also a welcome addtion to the attacking side.Some issues that were in the original are also present here: the transparency of the buildings is still a problem when rotating the map and trying to rebuild certain sections of the castle wall and the lack of hotkeys is fatal in the fast paced matches when trying to vanquish multiple opponents. The voices of the peasants are still provided by the same person, which was fun at frist, in Stronghold HD, but this time it's obviously budget related.Stronghold Crusader HD is obviously a letdown, not mainly because it feels like an expansion, but because it seems like a rather cheap duplicate of the great original. The new setting with all its accessories is a setback and the developer must have also felt the absence of the evil characters of the first game, because in the last mission we can meet them again (don't ask).You might think, "what is this guy talking about, this game isn't that bad" and you might be right, but if you played the original (and you really should have) you'll see how bad it is in comparison.Accordingly I can't recommend Stronghold Crusader HD to anyone: not to newcomers and especially not to fans of the original. If you want to experience a good siege just load up Stronghold HD again. PROS+ some useful additions and readjustments to the game+ last mission is challengingCONS- less emphasis on castle sieges- issues from the original are still present- campaign is not as enjoyable as the one in the original- feels like an expansion rather than a sequel- cheap ways to make the game harderRATING3/10

content:
Posted: December 3, 2015
												Though i have little hours on steam with this game i have played 100 hours of this game outside steam.Stronghold Crusader is a magnificent game as you have probably read from the other reviews. However, there is some key aspects to the game as in some game changing exploits that need to be made clear. Before you buy this game intending to pummel some people online into the ground i have come across a few exploits that unfortunately break the game.EXPLOITS ~~~ The exploits I'm about to talk about refer to the "sleep" mode given at every work space that your workers use. This sleep or making your workers redundant mode can be clicked with excessive speed. if you turn it on then off, the redundant mode (which is suppose to make your workers turn into peasants again) will pause your workers for a second then continue working, whilst more peasants turn into more workers which creates two workers for every one work space in stead of just one worker. this is known and duplicating your workers. this basically doubles your production rate which basically doubles your power. GG easy. (this was hard to explain)The second and most destructive (maybe not an exploit) "way of thinking" is to do with the redundant mode again. (making your workers turn back into peasants). After vsing someone online that i saw do this to me (and after commending him with his efforts after he butt♥♥♥♥♥♥♥me like a mad man) you are able to mass create an army using work spaces that require many peasants such as 'mills'. These mills hold 3 boys that take wheat and turn them into flour bags. But if you make 30 mills or so, over time your peasants will turn into these boys until all mills have work. Congratulations now hit the redundant button and gain your self 90 peasants instantaneously +24 peasants max cap at the castle. now i simply create 114 men then simple turn back off the redundant mode and start creating more boys for the mills. This way of working basically is a work around the max cap of 24 peasants at your castle, by simply turning your peasants into workers (for more holding space) then turning them back into peasants for mass production.After seeing my enemy have 500 horse archers and 35 catapults within 20 minutes of the game i could not get even close with anyone as 35 flying rocks also kills an army very fast let alone walls.Depressing as this was this is the reason why mills are so expensive in Stronghold Crusader 2 which is am SO THANKFUL FOR.Stronghold crusader is a great game but there is a glitich or two or a clever way of thinking that over powers the rest.I just want everyone to realise that this game has its issues that wont be fixed as the game is old but b4 you buy try to to cheat plz..... my butt is still sore. (multiplayer uses external program called 'game ranger' that is automatically installed - steam servers are not used)

content:
Posted: July 8, 2014
												The year is 1100 AD, and I'm a noble knight fighting my way across the Holy Lands. Although, I myself can't take on my foes alone, and all I brought with me into the desert are a couple loyal peasents, a handful of bricks, and some coins. What do I do? I build a castle, that's what. Stronghold Crusader HD is an old school RTS that focuses mainly on building and maintaining a thriving castle of your very own, and then using said castle and whoever is inside to crush your opponents. It's pretty much Age of Empires meets Total War, which is a combination that I never though could be possible. If you like strategy games but wish there was more of a creative aspect to your base-building and resource-gathering, then this is well worth your gold pieces.

content:
Posted: September 7, 2015
												Ah, Stronghold Crusader. I remember this game when I was maybe......6?This game really brings back memories with the floppy disk games.Anyway lets review!Note: Buying the game will also include Stronghold Crusader Extreme but that is so terrible so I wont review it.THE GAMEStronghold Crusader HD is a castle sim with I think 4 modes.Career/Story: Really just a set of tutorials and starting battles to get you ready to play the all grand skirmish mode(I think thats what its called) but never the less it can be fun but only sometimes.Skirmish/Battle: This is probably what makes this game grand. It puts you in a screen where you decide things like the map, how many players fight, where they fight, difficulty, starting money, etc. Then you start building a castle and an army to help you crush the other players while not getting recked yourself. THIS IS WHAT YOU GET THE GAME FOR. I bet it would be fun in MP but none of my friends have it :(Castle Builder- Just the mode if you want to build a huge castle, no enemies just you, your people, and that annoying flippin guide. (WHY?)Multiplayer- If someone wants to add me to play this mode please do ;_;AUDIOThe game has solid voice acting from every character and they talk to you at the right times sometimes indicating how you should prepare, like telling you "youre kingdom will get crushed" could indicating that they're lanuching an assault at you. The fighting audio is good but the people getting hit by arrows sounds like there coughing and screaming. Your castle based on how many people actually work it gets more or less chattery and theres less sounds of nature. The only REALLY bad voice acting is your guide, he doesnt change his accent when you change to like a british guy and his voice is just annoying but funny to abuse sometimes. Audio-8/10GAMEPLAYWell as I explained in the modes section you are usually fighting other players, but most of the time youre trying to get people in your kingdom and keep them in your kingdom by maintaning food, taxes, and atractions for your people (like a dancing bear strapped to a pole wtf). Gameplay 9/10STORYLINEI really dont think i should rate this but I will. The game yes has a story mode but it's mostly a tutorial with basic battles. The games story really comes mostly from the gameplay. Think of games like dota 2, CSGO, and TF2 mostly the story comes out of what you do and see, not whats told. Storyline 7/10GraphicsThe graphics would obvioulsy be outdated for a game as old as this but you can see whats going on and not feel like you cant see what that means or indicates. Pretty solid graphics if you look at its age. Im gonna count the score as if I was rating this in the year this was released. Graphics 10/10AI  Since this is what most people have to play with ill make a section for it. As I stated in audio the AI will give you hints about whats about to happen but it might not always happen, making them pretty clever enemies. Each king has a different tactic. Some  build the castle a lot others go and start buiding an army, and some also try to build up they're economy so they could buy troops late game. But each kind changes his tactic depending on what he sees so the AI is different every time.  It could use polishing sometimes though. AI 9/10REPLAYABILITYAs I just said the AI's tactic always changes so you never have the same game twice. Also there are TONS of different maps. By tons I mean like 30 maps each ranging on how many maximum players there can be and I think you are able to get more maps (IDK though). Replayability 10/10VERDICTStronghold Crusader's 10$ price tag is well worth it for such and old and polished game like this.FINAL RATING: 8.6/10

content:
Posted: August 7, 2015
												This has been a long time coming. SC is one game I have loved from day one. For the first time I played a game that was so complicated it took me a few days to master the economy. I had dreamed of a game like this since I played Warcraft as a small child. A game so realistic you actually had to gather raw materials it was a dream come true. Games have come and gone but SC always remained it was the only game that continued to hold my interest through the years. Even my friends got hooked and my wife who is by no means a gamer. The graphics were subpar even for the time but the gameplay was so entertaining it didn't matter. The attention to detail was beyond compare the concept of citizens you could not control was genius. Every building was bustling with people doing work and sounds of every trade rang out in a crowded village square. I developed many working strategies over the years it was as if there really were no rules. You were limited only by what crazy attack you could think up and how well you executed it. But it wasn't just the gameplay that was exceptional the programming was amazing. The 2D drawing of 3D objects made the game tiny and playable on the oldest computers. I used to carry a copy in my mp3 player so I could play anywhere. It worked on any network without any errors ever seriously in 12 years! I swear this game would run over two tin cans on a string. At some LAN parties we didn't even bother setting up a network we just plugged all the computers into a hub and SC would work even when windows didn't show any other network locations. I still play my original copy and have only encountered a few glitches. I wish they would just remake this game with top of the line graphics. I'll be playing this game till the day I die -SEF

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 25, 2015
												Stronghold Crusader mixes castle building, RTS, and resource management. The campaign will teach you most of the things from resource gathering, building and defending your castle, to sieging the enemy and defending your castle. Stronghold Crusader has 16 AI lords, each lord has different strategies and difficulties. They also have a different castle builds and troop choices. You can choose to use Arab or European troops or even all together. The extreme edition is a faster paced version of the game that you can play separately from the original game.Stronghold Crusader is one of my favorite RTS games. It is very similar to its predecessor, Stronghold, but it has more content than Stronghold. I first played it since 2007 and bought the steam version recently. It was one of the best and most addicting game I played back then. The game is quite simple when you get the hang of it. The gameplay is still great till this day, even though the game was from 2001. And I really like the HD addition to the game, the max resolution used to be 1024x768 and after the HD addition you can play with almost any resolution. The AI is also quite challenging. The skirmish mode and custom games will add many hours to the game. The soundtrack for Stronghold Crusader is fantastic. I really like the soundtrack of this game. The voice acting is kinda bad, but it really fits with the game somehow. I really like how Arabian units speak Arabic. The integration with Steam Cloud is one of the reasons I bought the Steam version of the game.However, Stronghold Crusader has a minor flaw. The lack of Steam overlay. You can't chat with friends without alt-tabbing and you can't take screenshots via Steam too.In conclusion, even though the game looks outdated, it truly withstood the test of time. Stronghold Crusader is still a very good game and will give hours of fun. I really recommend this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 3, 2016
												"Greetings Lord Flying Poo!"(enter your name as Flying Poo and restart the game... you're welcome!)Stronghold Crusader was and still is my all time favorite stragegy title ever (followed closely by A Bridge Too Far and the older Command and Conquer titles).Having tried the whole Stronghold series I've found the rest of the titles to be a failed attempt at getting the recipe correct.Stronghold Crusader 2 Hasn't worked it's wonders on me either.Anywho! Crusader is a 3D effect 2D title with basic graphics (good for it's day) and superb gameplay.The title has been remastered slightly to allow for more modern display resolutions (hence the "HD" in the title) as before you were limited to 1024x786 on your shiny 1080p screen!Now you can see a full 1080p so play on huge TV is even possible!The aim of this game is simple, start mission with barely any resources but usually enough to build the basics and start your first line of defence, your castle!Once in full swing you'll have peasant turning into bakers, diary farmers, pub landlords, woodcutters, stonemasons and many more to build your stockpile and granary. You'll need to balance these carefully as the more peasants you have living in your castle the more food they need.Once your resources are taken care of you need to build an army.Building an army is done of in one of 3 ways, either supplying the armour and weapons (making these from iron, leather etc) and combining these with jobless peasants to create a mega army, making an army from mercenary posts (not as strong as a self made army but a quick way of buidling numbers) or relying on a outpost (disabled in some missions).Your objective from this point is clear... destroy your enemies.Why is Crusader special? It's got a certain charisma and charm, it just feels right. It's very easy to pickup so great for beginners and advanced gamers and will keep anyone interested for many hours!Did I mention the castle builder and map creator modes?Castle builder is for those who just want to create a castle and be left alone for hours on end until it's self sustaining.Map creator is for those who want to (let's be honest now) create a map with an unfair advantage to the other players.System requirements are so low you could run it on anything from a super low spec Intel Atom to an 16core Xeon.Overall I'd say a solid 10/10 and a must have for anyones steam account.I hope there is a Crusader 3, but I strongly hope they base it on this title rather than the other Stronghold series.Also, if reworked slightly for Linux compatabilty, perhaps getting it to run on a Raspberry Pi 2!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 28, 2015
												Years after I played Stronghold Crusader for the first time, I happen to find it again on Steam. I've immediately started playing for hours, because even after all these years, it's one of the best games I've played. The economic systems are really great, the castle building is fun and sieging and battling your enemies should keep you occupied for quite some time!Also fling dead cows into your enemy base, burn their castle down and dig moats around their entire fort, which will make them starve, run out of pretty much every resource and beg for mercy,10/10, still playing.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 7, 2015
												Ah, Stronghold Crusader. I remember this game when I was maybe......6?This game really brings back memories with the floppy disk games.Anyway lets review!Note: Buying the game will also include Stronghold Crusader Extreme but that is so terrible so I wont review it.THE GAMEStronghold Crusader HD is a castle sim with I think 4 modes.Career/Story: Really just a set of tutorials and starting battles to get you ready to play the all grand skirmish mode(I think thats what its called) but never the less it can be fun but only sometimes.Skirmish/Battle: This is probably what makes this game grand. It puts you in a screen where you decide things like the map, how many players fight, where they fight, difficulty, starting money, etc. Then you start building a castle and an army to help you crush the other players while not getting recked yourself. THIS IS WHAT YOU GET THE GAME FOR. I bet it would be fun in MP but none of my friends have it :(Castle Builder- Just the mode if you want to build a huge castle, no enemies just you, your people, and that annoying flippin guide. (WHY?)Multiplayer- If someone wants to add me to play this mode please do ;_;AUDIOThe game has solid voice acting from every character and they talk to you at the right times sometimes indicating how you should prepare, like telling you "youre kingdom will get crushed" could indicating that they're lanuching an assault at you. The fighting audio is good but the people getting hit by arrows sounds like there coughing and screaming. Your castle based on how many people actually work it gets more or less chattery and theres less sounds of nature. The only REALLY bad voice acting is your guide, he doesnt change his accent when you change to like a british guy and his voice is just annoying but funny to abuse sometimes. Audio-8/10GAMEPLAYWell as I explained in the modes section you are usually fighting other players, but most of the time youre trying to get people in your kingdom and keep them in your kingdom by maintaning food, taxes, and atractions for your people (like a dancing bear strapped to a pole wtf). Gameplay 9/10STORYLINEI really dont think i should rate this but I will. The game yes has a story mode but it's mostly a tutorial with basic battles. The games story really comes mostly from the gameplay. Think of games like dota 2, CSGO, and TF2 mostly the story comes out of what you do and see, not whats told. Storyline 7/10GraphicsThe graphics would obvioulsy be outdated for a game as old as this but you can see whats going on and not feel like you cant see what that means or indicates. Pretty solid graphics if you look at its age. Im gonna count the score as if I was rating this in the year this was released. Graphics 10/10AI  Since this is what most people have to play with ill make a section for it. As I stated in audio the AI will give you hints about whats about to happen but it might not always happen, making them pretty clever enemies. Each king has a different tactic. Some  build the castle a lot others go and start buiding an army, and some also try to build up they're economy so they could buy troops late game. But each kind changes his tactic depending on what he sees so the AI is different every time.  It could use polishing sometimes though. AI 9/10REPLAYABILITYAs I just said the AI's tactic always changes so you never have the same game twice. Also there are TONS of different maps. By tons I mean like 30 maps each ranging on how many maximum players there can be and I think you are able to get more maps (IDK though). Replayability 10/10VERDICTStronghold Crusader's 10$ price tag is well worth it for such and old and polished game like this.FINAL RATING: 8.6/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 3, 2016
												"Greetings Lord Flying Poo!"(enter your name as Flying Poo and restart the game... you're welcome!)Stronghold Crusader was and still is my all time favorite stragegy title ever (followed closely by A Bridge Too Far and the older Command and Conquer titles).Having tried the whole Stronghold series I've found the rest of the titles to be a failed attempt at getting the recipe correct.Stronghold Crusader 2 Hasn't worked it's wonders on me either.Anywho! Crusader is a 3D effect 2D title with basic graphics (good for it's day) and superb gameplay.The title has been remastered slightly to allow for more modern display resolutions (hence the "HD" in the title) as before you were limited to 1024x786 on your shiny 1080p screen!Now you can see a full 1080p so play on huge TV is even possible!The aim of this game is simple, start mission with barely any resources but usually enough to build the basics and start your first line of defence, your castle!Once in full swing you'll have peasant turning into bakers, diary farmers, pub landlords, woodcutters, stonemasons and many more to build your stockpile and granary. You'll need to balance these carefully as the more peasants you have living in your castle the more food they need.Once your resources are taken care of you need to build an army.Building an army is done of in one of 3 ways, either supplying the armour and weapons (making these from iron, leather etc) and combining these with jobless peasants to create a mega army, making an army from mercenary posts (not as strong as a self made army but a quick way of buidling numbers) or relying on a outpost (disabled in some missions).Your objective from this point is clear... destroy your enemies.Why is Crusader special? It's got a certain charisma and charm, it just feels right. It's very easy to pickup so great for beginners and advanced gamers and will keep anyone interested for many hours!Did I mention the castle builder and map creator modes?Castle builder is for those who just want to create a castle and be left alone for hours on end until it's self sustaining.Map creator is for those who want to (let's be honest now) create a map with an unfair advantage to the other players.System requirements are so low you could run it on anything from a super low spec Intel Atom to an 16core Xeon.Overall I'd say a solid 10/10 and a must have for anyones steam account.I hope there is a Crusader 3, but I strongly hope they base it on this title rather than the other Stronghold series.Also, if reworked slightly for Linux compatabilty, perhaps getting it to run on a Raspberry Pi 2!

content:
Posted: December 1, 2013
												Who wouldn't want to command medieval warriors during the crusades? You can be the Crusaders, or the Arabian Forces of the Middle East. Build epic castles, attack epic castles, live in epic castles, and eat in epic castles. But, you, as a lord, must keep thy people happy. Thy people will need food, protection, shelter, and mongooses. Okay, maybe not mongooses.Fear factor is also a thing to keep in mind, if you are a jerk no one will want to be in your castle. If you are nice and save the dying tigers in Africa people will want to work for you. Also, if you're nice your troops will do better in combat. If you're mean your troops will do worst in combat.I have only played 4 hours as of writing this review and I already love this game.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2015
												Though i have little hours on steam with this game i have played 100 hours of this game outside steam.Stronghold Crusader is a magnificent game as you have probably read from the other reviews. However, there is some key aspects to the game as in some game changing exploits that need to be made clear. Before you buy this game intending to pummel some people online into the ground i have come across a few exploits that unfortunately break the game.EXPLOITS ~~~ The exploits I'm about to talk about refer to the "sleep" mode given at every work space that your workers use. This sleep or making your workers redundant mode can be clicked with excessive speed. if you turn it on then off, the redundant mode (which is suppose to make your workers turn into peasants again) will pause your workers for a second then continue working, whilst more peasants turn into more workers which creates two workers for every one work space in stead of just one worker. this is known and duplicating your workers. this basically doubles your production rate which basically doubles your power. GG easy. (this was hard to explain)The second and most destructive (maybe not an exploit) "way of thinking" is to do with the redundant mode again. (making your workers turn back into peasants). After vsing someone online that i saw do this to me (and after commending him with his efforts after he butt♥♥♥♥♥♥♥me like a mad man) you are able to mass create an army using work spaces that require many peasants such as 'mills'. These mills hold 3 boys that take wheat and turn them into flour bags. But if you make 30 mills or so, over time your peasants will turn into these boys until all mills have work. Congratulations now hit the redundant button and gain your self 90 peasants instantaneously +24 peasants max cap at the castle. now i simply create 114 men then simple turn back off the redundant mode and start creating more boys for the mills. This way of working basically is a work around the max cap of 24 peasants at your castle, by simply turning your peasants into workers (for more holding space) then turning them back into peasants for mass production.After seeing my enemy have 500 horse archers and 35 catapults within 20 minutes of the game i could not get even close with anyone as 35 flying rocks also kills an army very fast let alone walls.Depressing as this was this is the reason why mills are so expensive in Stronghold Crusader 2 which is am SO THANKFUL FOR.Stronghold crusader is a great game but there is a glitich or two or a clever way of thinking that over powers the rest.I just want everyone to realise that this game has its issues that wont be fixed as the game is old but b4 you buy try to to cheat plz..... my butt is still sore. (multiplayer uses external program called 'game ranger' that is automatically installed - steam servers are not used)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												Greetings sire! The desert awaits you!Thats the first line you gonna hear...thats the only line you ever will need...The best desert castle builder i can remember of...+Good diversion of units to use+Castle management (your materials you use for building structures, building your army or satisfying your people)+Diverse selection of AI enemies you can fight against+Nice selection of maps+Long and somehow challenging campaign maps (have chance to even 3x skip mission if its too hard to overcome)+Historical campaigns+You can chose wheter you want an european lord or arabic lord as your lord skin+Map editor+Nice graphics for an old game+EXTREME - play good ol´ stronghold in an extreme way, more armies and special abilities to help you...contains a campaign too thats is really challenging (never completed it myself)+Castle builder mode, for those moments when you want peacefully build up a castle that will endure the test of time...-AI sometimes - they try to build their boxy predefined castles even when there is no space for them to build it there, either leaving them with holes in the walls where tower should be but cant be placed or totally boxed with no gate for their workers to gather materials/food-AI again - they attack in small bunches instead of big mass, granting you easy chance to effectively destroy the whole siege part by part by your archers and crossbowmen or your mangonels and ballistaeAlso there is no story or main character in the whole campaign...you are just unnamed lord who want to conquest every battlefield...some people might find this discouraging....but everything is permitted in war so grab your sword and fight...Source: apart of having quite small amount of hours played on steam version i played more than 500 hours on classic Stronghold Crusader + Warchest and Stronghold Crusader Extreme before it even hit steam in HD edition....Definetly worth every penny if you like castle builders, medieval warfare or their combinations...

												Back before Steam I bought this game 4 times. played it so damn much i wore out the disk, every chance i got i would share this game with my friends, either giving them an extra copy, or reccomending they buy it. 250 hours alone on steam doesn't nearly count towards my total time over the past 10 years. the amount of humour put into the dialogue of characters, with the cheesy cgi, and the somewhat sassy match narrator, the incredibly memorable music, the seemingly endless campaign map, the nearly overwhelming odds in the later missions, the great map editor, the variety of Ai designed castles, with various schemes and unit themes set to their playstyle, all of this adds up to one of the most solidly memorable, and always revisitable strategy/building sims ever made. its a joyous ride for someone who enjoys min-maxing, equally as much as someone who enjoys relaxed building. Under 10$, and on sale for $2.50 is an absolute steal.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 15, 2016
												This game is perhaps overlooked by most people these days, considering there are others out there, like StarCraft, Age of Empires, Civilization, and plenty of lesser known RTS games.Yet, this game has a certain charm to it that I think can't be found anywhere else. It's set in the Arabic desert, where you must fight for survival by mastering as many factors as you can, including some staple RTS features, like economics, resources, troops, and workers. This game also features two main ways to determine whether you succeed or not. This comes in the form of managing how much gold you have to buy troops, and how much food you have collected. Running out of food will cause your castle to start losing happiness, and people will begin to leave if it gets below halfway.Since the food plays a major role in your economy, lacking it presents a severe problem of unbalanced gameplay; people won't be able to keep your economy going if they leave, which means that, if you don't have enough gold to buy food, you're basically doomed. You can't buy troops since you don't have gold, and if, by some chance, you happen to be out of other supplies, it's best to give up if you don't have any allies. Even then, the allies aren't guaranteed to help you, especially if they're A.I players.This is where the unbalanced issue comes into place, because not everyone is good at managing their economy, and pitting people with little to no sense of economics against people who do know means that the latter are going to win. Every single time.This is still a great game, though.  If you are willing to learn how to manage economics, I recommend this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 3, 2016
												Stronghold Crusader, war damals mit eines der Ersten Spiele, die ich sehr aktiv gespielt habe und heute mag ich das Spiel nach wie vor immer noch sehr gerne. Auch wenn die Grafik ein wenig veraltet scheint ist es einfach ein Klassiker und macht auch mit dieser Grafik viel mehr Spaß als die ganzen viel neueren Teilen mit der angeblich besseren Grafik. Das Spiel bietet für jeden etwas. Man kann zum Beispiel, wenn man nicht so auf die aktiven Schlachten steht seine eigene Burg bauen ohne feindliche Angriffe oder ein eigenes Szenario erstellen, welches man an andere Spieler schicken kann, welche sich dann an Eurem Szenario versuchen können. Selbstverständlich bietet dieses Spiel auch zwei Kampagnen durch welche man sich durch kämpfen kann, wobei der Schwierigkeitsgrad immer wieder auf eine höhere Stufe gestellt wird und man lernen muss beispielsweise nur durch den Steinabbau seine Burg finanzieren kann. Außerdem sind auch vier Szenarien aus der Geschichte eingebaut worden, welche auf mehrere kleine Szenarien aufgeteilt wurden.Für Anfänger wird es wahrscheinlich sehr hilfreich sein erstmal schnelle Spiele zu starten, in denen man entscheiden kann inwiefern man einen Vorteil oder Nachteil gegenüber den anderen Spielern beziehungsweise Computer Gegnern erhalten soll.Das Spiel stellt zusätzlich noch eine Möglichkeit bereit im Multiplayer gegeneinander spielen zu können. Hierbei empfiehlt es sich in einem lokalen Netzwerk zu spielen, da man über Hamachi mit vielen Verzögerungen rechnen muss.Insgesamt aber würde ich dieses Spiel jedem empfehlen, der Interesse am Mittelalter hat und auf Strategie- Spiele steht. Für Jemanden, der sich mehr um die Grafik schert, wird dieses Spiel nicht das Beste sein, weil es nun auch schon ein paar Jahre auf den Buckel hat. Sollte dies der Fall sein empfiehlen sich eher Stronghold Crusader 2 oder auch Stronghold 3 oder vielleicht auch Stronghold 2 und Legends.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												Greetings sire! The desert awaits you!Thats the first line you gonna hear...thats the only line you ever will need...The best desert castle builder i can remember of...+Good diversion of units to use+Castle management (your materials you use for building structures, building your army or satisfying your people)+Diverse selection of AI enemies you can fight against+Nice selection of maps+Long and somehow challenging campaign maps (have chance to even 3x skip mission if its too hard to overcome)+Historical campaigns+You can chose wheter you want an european lord or arabic lord as your lord skin+Map editor+Nice graphics for an old game+EXTREME - play good ol´ stronghold in an extreme way, more armies and special abilities to help you...contains a campaign too thats is really challenging (never completed it myself)+Castle builder mode, for those moments when you want peacefully build up a castle that will endure the test of time...-AI sometimes - they try to build their boxy predefined castles even when there is no space for them to build it there, either leaving them with holes in the walls where tower should be but cant be placed or totally boxed with no gate for their workers to gather materials/food-AI again - they attack in small bunches instead of big mass, granting you easy chance to effectively destroy the whole siege part by part by your archers and crossbowmen or your mangonels and ballistaeAlso there is no story or main character in the whole campaign...you are just unnamed lord who want to conquest every battlefield...some people might find this discouraging....but everything is permitted in war so grab your sword and fight...Source: apart of having quite small amount of hours played on steam version i played more than 500 hours on classic Stronghold Crusader + Warchest and Stronghold Crusader Extreme before it even hit steam in HD edition....Definetly worth every penny if you like castle builders, medieval warfare or their combinations...

number of helpful: No ratings yet1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 30, 2016
												Stronghold Crusader, one of my favorite RTS games of my childhood. It has some of the best AI characters, despite their seemingly awful decision making when it comes to trading. It also has a pleasing graphic style that despite its age looks great, and even better in HD. The game's style is not only tied to it graphics, but to its AI and even its UI. The game gives you useful information through an advisor who also displays your favor. The advisor's voice is not annoying and I still remember his voice. The game is a gem and I can't recommend it enough and the HD upgrade looks great. (Note: It is only a resoultion upgrade, not a texture one.)The Good: AI Personalities                  Voice Acting *(The ham adds to the charm)                  Graphical Style                  Music                  UI                  Game Mechanics                  Great SingleplayerThe Meh: AI Difficulty The Bad: No Steam OverlayOverall: 8/10 Would recommend and remember always, Wood Needed.(Update #1 - Steam Overlay)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												Oh, the memories... Lions are attacking,my Liege! Assassins are scaling our walls,Sire! The lions have taken control over our gatehouse,Sire...My friend showed me this gem when we were about 10. Immediately fell in love with the game, cuz medieval stuff. Last year heated this up again to multi-play with friends to celebrate the end of our university years. Still a gem.PRO:+You can build huge castles+You can destroy huge castles (just need a ton of catapults)+Variety in strategy (from destroying castles in seconds with catapults, through picking off defenders one by one with clouds of arrows/darts, to single rushing in with your king because YOLO)+Burn it to the ground! (With flaming arrows and pitch, boiling oil, fire ballistas, torches... and whatever stuff is in those jars Fire Throwers throw.)+Exploit minor bugs against AI+Here comes Bessy!CON:-AI is stupid, games become easy/non-challenging after a while (I may have a few hundred hours of gameplay off-record ;))-no attack move (your units engage enemy only if they run directly into them)-Multiplayer kinda sucks. If you can rush your opponent, it's over too fast, if you can't, it'll never end.-Hidden population limit. I never really figured this out, but it seems to be around a few hundred. I want to conquer the Holy City with my Golden Horde! (gold 'n hoard,eh)...also. Wood needed!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 23, 2016
												One of the best games I've ever played with. Considering that more people were working on the music - which is one of the most significant part of the game - it's the best I've played with. Best strategy game, easily. I spent 2 summers morning till night while I was in elementary school. Not only teaches strategic thinking (you'll need a lot for the warchest trail's later missions), but also basic history.I was on the hil in my tiny castle. My troops of hundreds were awaiting my command to attack one of the three of the wolf borthers. First I ordered my archers to move forward and clear the path. As they were fearlessly marching towards the shooting range a bunch of catapult rocks bashed the ground. Right in the middle of the crowd. I've seen big losses, a lot of massacre in my time. I remembered when I was part of that crowd. Approximately thirty of my archers fell in just one counterattack the wolf responded with.He didn't have a second shot though. My men's rain of arrows ruthlessly killed everyone in the tower. It was time to march closer. I ordered my mace men and knights to approach the back gate. I knew by the time they get there, there will be no troops on the wall to harm them. the assassins will have taken care of them by then.Not even a day past and the castle was empty. I ordered my archers not to shoot any civilians. I wanted the glory for myself.As I walked towards the huge hole in the wolf's castle wall...through the countless dead bodies of my and his fallen men, I remembered. I remembered why am I doing this. Not for the Glory. The only reason is...This is when the merciless message smashed my bubble..."Stronghold Crusader HD has stopped working"Great times!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 7, 2015
												Ah, Stronghold Crusader. I remember this game when I was maybe......6?This game really brings back memories with the floppy disk games.Anyway lets review!Note: Buying the game will also include Stronghold Crusader Extreme but that is so terrible so I wont review it.THE GAMEStronghold Crusader HD is a castle sim with I think 4 modes.Career/Story: Really just a set of tutorials and starting battles to get you ready to play the all grand skirmish mode(I think thats what its called) but never the less it can be fun but only sometimes.Skirmish/Battle: This is probably what makes this game grand. It puts you in a screen where you decide things like the map, how many players fight, where they fight, difficulty, starting money, etc. Then you start building a castle and an army to help you crush the other players while not getting recked yourself. THIS IS WHAT YOU GET THE GAME FOR. I bet it would be fun in MP but none of my friends have it :(Castle Builder- Just the mode if you want to build a huge castle, no enemies just you, your people, and that annoying flippin guide. (WHY?)Multiplayer- If someone wants to add me to play this mode please do ;_;AUDIOThe game has solid voice acting from every character and they talk to you at the right times sometimes indicating how you should prepare, like telling you "youre kingdom will get crushed" could indicating that they're lanuching an assault at you. The fighting audio is good but the people getting hit by arrows sounds like there coughing and screaming. Your castle based on how many people actually work it gets more or less chattery and theres less sounds of nature. The only REALLY bad voice acting is your guide, he doesnt change his accent when you change to like a british guy and his voice is just annoying but funny to abuse sometimes. Audio-8/10GAMEPLAYWell as I explained in the modes section you are usually fighting other players, but most of the time youre trying to get people in your kingdom and keep them in your kingdom by maintaning food, taxes, and atractions for your people (like a dancing bear strapped to a pole wtf). Gameplay 9/10STORYLINEI really dont think i should rate this but I will. The game yes has a story mode but it's mostly a tutorial with basic battles. The games story really comes mostly from the gameplay. Think of games like dota 2, CSGO, and TF2 mostly the story comes out of what you do and see, not whats told. Storyline 7/10GraphicsThe graphics would obvioulsy be outdated for a game as old as this but you can see whats going on and not feel like you cant see what that means or indicates. Pretty solid graphics if you look at its age. Im gonna count the score as if I was rating this in the year this was released. Graphics 10/10AI  Since this is what most people have to play with ill make a section for it. As I stated in audio the AI will give you hints about whats about to happen but it might not always happen, making them pretty clever enemies. Each king has a different tactic. Some  build the castle a lot others go and start buiding an army, and some also try to build up they're economy so they could buy troops late game. But each kind changes his tactic depending on what he sees so the AI is different every time.  It could use polishing sometimes though. AI 9/10REPLAYABILITYAs I just said the AI's tactic always changes so you never have the same game twice. Also there are TONS of different maps. By tons I mean like 30 maps each ranging on how many maximum players there can be and I think you are able to get more maps (IDK though). Replayability 10/10VERDICTStronghold Crusader's 10$ price tag is well worth it for such and old and polished game like this.FINAL RATING: 8.6/10

Was kinda sad. 10/10 would do again.Wood needed!

content:
Posted: July 6, 2016
												Absolutely one of the best Real Time Strategy games bar none, having been playing Stronghold Crusader for what is probably a couple years short of a decade I am a very large authority on determining the replay value of this game. Having made it most of the way through the original Crusader Trail, and currently working on (near halfway or a little past  halfway of) the Warchest trail, I can definitely attest that this game is definitely not a casual pick-me-up in terms of the campaign. It begins pretty easily in terms of either campaign, personally boasting a completion time in some cases of two minutes or less in some of the beginning missions. However, it works the player up to the difficulty in the two campaigns slightly and then really tosses you into some challenging and interesting scenarios designed to make you think and put you out of your comfort zone. Experiment with different tactics and tower placement, send a detachment of horse archers here or there, and you can really work the battlefield in your favor. This is really a game for the RTS lover as well as those new to the genre, as one can play the less difficult Historical Campaigns to become better at the game, or cruise around in the Custom Games sector and you can formulate your own battles and challenges to overcome. With many different computer oppenents with mostly each opponent being unique, there is a very large portion of depth and ability to really challenge and engage the player. Each opponent has a different personality for the most part, and they each ask and send goods as well as manage armies and their economies in entirely respective and different manners. Having in some cases very beneficial troop movement strategies and in others there may be a lot to be desired. This however adds to the difference in difficulty with each of the different opponents, allowing for--again lots of different customization in scenarios as well as replay value just in the Custom Games sector alone. Not to mention, all of this is about the offline play. Definitely a good purchase at any price, you should really add this gem to your collection.
